Sega of America, a maker of video games, will begin a campaign next week that takes a hit at rival Nintendo of America.

The spots show the action on Sega's Genesis sports video games, like Joe Montana's Football and Michael Jackson's Moonwalker as an announcer tells viewers: ''You can't do this on Nintendo.'' Because of technological differences, Genesis games cannot be played on the Nintendo system.
At the end of the spot, a message flashes on the screen: ''Genesis does what Nintendon't.''

Created by the Los Angeles office of Bozell, the $10 million campaign is an attempt to loosen Nintendo's dominance of the $3 billion video game market. Nintendo has about 80 percent of the market, compared to Sega's 15 percent share.
Ninetendo is also starting a new campaign next week, and a spokesman for the company said the details would be announced today.
